text.0: ye by your hymns are like highthoughted singers skilful inviting gods with sacrifices.
text.1: fair to behold like kings with bright adornment like spotless gallants leaders of the people.
text.2: like fire with flashing flame breastbound with chains of gold like tempestblasts selfmoving swift to lend your aid.
text.3: as best of all foreknowers excellent to guide like somas good to guard the man who follows law.
text.4: shakers of all like gales of wind they travel like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence.
text.5: mighty are they as warriors clad in armour and like the fathers prayers most bounteous givers.
text.6: like spokes of carwheels in one nave united ever victorious like heavenly heroes.
text.7: shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers.
text.8: they who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers.
text.9: like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods like omniform aṅgirases with sāmahymns.
text.10: born from the stream like pressstones are the princes for ever like the stones that crush in pieces.
text.11: sons of a beauteous dame like playful children like a great host upon the march with splendour.
text.12: like rays of dawn the visitors of sacrifice they shine with ornaments as eager to be bright.
text.13: like rivers hasting on glittering with their spears from far away they measure out the distances.
text.14: gods send us happiness and make us wealthy letting us singers prosper o ye maruts.
text.15: bethink you of our praise and of our friendship ye from of old have riches to vouchsafe us.
